text: Thanks Chad that was really helpful !

<@U01T4LC601X> I think is possible...

...You have with `hubdb_table_rows()` the option to use filter querys:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/features/hubdb>

Available type of filter are documented in the API: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/hubdb/v2/get_table_rows>

On your response object you can use the random filter:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/filters#random>

Heads up the `override_inherited_src` param is not working on the `{% module %}` version of the @HubSpot/logo, but it is on the `{% logo %}` tag
```{% module 'header_logo_desktop' path='@HubSpot/logo', 
  label='Logo desktop', 
  override_inherited_src=True,
  src='{{ logo_desktop }}',
  width=200,
  extra_classes='header__logo' 
%}
{% logo 'header_logo_desktop' 
  label='Logo desktop', 
  override_inherited_src=True,
  src='{{ logo_desktop }}',
  width=200,
  extra_classes='header__logo' 
%}```
`override_inherited_src` is part of the `img` field object
aahhh theyâ€™re different. I assumed they were the same, just different syntax
